dogecoin.text:
What started as a joke in 2013 became one of the most recognizable cryptocurrencies in the world.

Is Dogecoin just a meme, or could it become the future of payments? 🤔

What do you think? Drop your thoughts below! 👇
10/10

Today, Dogecoin is still one of the top cryptocurrencies, accepted by companies like Tesla & AMC for payments.

Developers have returned to improve it, and there are talks of integrating $DOGE into X (Twitter payments).

Could Dogecoin actually go mainstream?
9/10

Dogecoin’s rise sparked a meme coin revolution. It inspired coins like Shiba Inu ($SHIB), Floki Inu, and many others.

But it also showed the power of community & hype in crypto.

Can a joke coin become a real currency? Some believe it can.
8/10

In 2020, Elon Musk started tweeting about Dogecoin.

He called it “the people’s crypto”, making its price skyrocket. Retail investors flooded in, and $DOGE hit an all-time high of $0.73 in 2021.

A coin created as a joke had a $90 billion market cap!
7/10

Despite the fun, Dogecoin had problems.

The creators never meant for it to be serious, so they left the project.

This led to a lack of development, and for years, Dogecoin became just another meme coin—until Elon Musk entered the scene.
6/10

Dogecoin’s friendly community started using it for tips, donations, and even charity work.

In 2014, they raised $50,000 in DOGE to send the Jamaican bobsled team to the Winter Olympics!

Then they funded a clean water project in Kenya.
5/10

Within a few days, Dogecoin was born. It was based on Litecoin’s code but designed for fun, with low fees & fast transactions.

Launched in December 2013, $DOGE gained traction immediately.

But no one expected what happened next…

4/10

At the time, the Doge meme—featuring a Shiba Inu dog with funny captions—was going viral.

Palmer jokingly tweeted:
"Investing in Dogecoin, the next big thing!"

People loved it and urged him to make it real. That’s when Markus joined in.
3/10

In 2013, two software engineers decided to make a joke cryptocurrency to poke fun at Bitcoin and the crypto hype.

Little did they know, their joke would become a multi-billion-dollar phenomenon.

Here’s the wild story of Dogecoin ($DOGE). 🧵👇
1/10
